body:
Thank you for making this issue :-)

@dibu28 wrote the original code - would you like to add these?

It should be reasonably straight forward to add `Move`, `MoveDir` and `Copy`...

Though looking at the Yandex code it is one of the early remotes so I think it would benefit from being re-written to use the rest library which would be a bit more work.

>@dibu28 wrote the original code - would you like to add these?

Sure, it's my fault, it just takes time to get used to the github customs.
I'm working on a major overhaul of Yandex backend right now. Pull request most likely tomorrow.

issue.title: yandex: Major rewrite

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This is a very WIP version of my Yandex rewrite. This aims to fix #2586 and make Yandex more maintainable by rewriting it using rclone rest implementation. The optional interfaces asked for in #2586 are not yet implemented however I will do so in the next days. The basic functionality should be working by now.

The main reason for opening the PR this early is that I definitely need help with testing this one. ~~Due to some weirdness with my ISP my connections to Yandex is absolutely abysmal and I cannot even run the integration tests without them constantly timing out or failing for other connection related reasons.~~ 

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
